title: Junction rule - unknown current in circuit

content.description: The circuit shown consists of batteries with <math alttext="e m f" overflow="scroll"> <mi>emf</mi> </math> <math alttext="script uppercase E sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Ɛ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="script uppercase E sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Ɛ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> and resistors <math alttext="R sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="R sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. content.question: What are the value and the direction of the current through Resistor <math alttext="R sub 1" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> </math> in the circuit shown?

choices.label: <math alttext="1.0 amp" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> toward the top of the page
